work.name: Lever Labs
highlights: Designed complete hardware system for educational robot: 4-layer ESP32 PCB with Li-ion charging, buck/boost converters, sensors (IMU, ToF, color sensor, encoders), user interface (OLED, LEDs, buzzer), three custom flex peripheral boards, and injection-mold-ready clamshell enclosure

Solved critical hardware issues through 5 board revisions including I2C stability and ESP32 brownout during motor switching; optimized DFM with Hirose board-to-board connectors eliminating manual soldering, reducing cost from $200+ to $69 and assembly time from 45 minutes to 4 minutes
Worked directly with contract manufacturer in China on electronics production; piloted with 30+ students, accumulating hundreds of hours of real-world classroom validation
